meanings.definition: to treat rubber with sulfur to improve its strength and elasticity.
meanings.sent1: The factory vulcanises the rubber to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: Rubber vulcanises when sulfur is added to it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber band go to therapy? It needed to vulcanise its strength!
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them vulcanises over time, becoming unbreakable like rubber.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to vulcanise the rubber ball, making it bounce higher than ever before.

meanings.definition: undergo a chemical process to become vulcanized.
meanings.sent1: The rubber vulcanises in the heat, transforming into a stronger material.
meanings.sent2: When exposed to high temperatures, rubber vulcanises and becomes more durable.
meanings.sent3: The rubber tire decided to vulcanise itself for a new adventure on the road.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed vulcanises within her, making her unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The old memories vulcanise in his mind, becoming more vivid and resilient with time.
